title: What should I bring to Coachella? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok, so here are all the things I normally bring to festivals like Coachella. Always make sure you check if what you’re bringing is within the guidelines though. That way you don’t have to leave and come back. Tent/Canopy (I had a big private tent when I went. If you’re not camping there, there’s not point though)ChairsSleeping bagsBattery-powered fan (handheld or big)Batteries to go with said fanRadio or speaker (battery powered for music all day/night if you’re one of those kinds of people)WATER & Ice in a cooler (Some of the bottles I had were frozen and I lined the coolers with them, put ice on top, and put the unfrozen water on it. Layering the cooler last longer) (PS, dry ice lasts the whole weekend and if you wrap it in newspaper and use it to line the cooler, you’d be good. BUT DON’T TOUCH IT WITH BARE HANDS!)Food & Snacks (I had a small grill and hotdogs along with a whole bunch of other snacks, but I was with a group of people)SunscreenPortable charger for phones (I was with friends so I had brought my collection of 10 and a solar-powered charger)EarplugsFace wipesHandsanitizerPortable shower or “shower in a can” (Bath & Body has a shower in a bottle foam that I used for things like this. Not sure if they make it anymore though)Whatever medications you’re supposed to take (I brought Advil and my regular medications in the original bottles)FLASHLIGHTS

What should you bring to Coachella? If you’ve attended music festivals before then just follow most of the same common sense measures that you would for any other event: Dress comfortably – it gets quite hot during the day and you will be out for nearly 12 hours for three daysGood (comfortable!) shoes – not only will you be on your feet for most of the day you'd be walking a few miles and dancing a fair bitKeep a cap / hat / something to cover the headSunscreenSunglasses (cheap ones – it is crowded and you will be moving / dancing so there’s always a probability of losing them)Just to be on the safe side, keep some cold weather gear- it does get chilly in the nightIt has rained in the past in Indio during April, so keep a poncho if you canThere are lockers inside the venue and they’re definitely worth it! Drop off whatever stuff you don’t need to have with you all the time inside and move around with ease. The lockers do sell out so make sure you book one at the earliest Outside food and water is not allowed. However you are allowed to bring in an empty plastic bottle, which you can keep refilling at the water stationsMedicines (with prescriptions)Tissues / wet wipesThe Coachella app is useful – you can find out the artist schedule / stages on itPortable phone chargerI would have added carrying cash to the list but Coachella is partnering with Square and Apple Pay this year so hopefully cashless transactions will address the need for thatHave fun!
